page.title: 03VISIT TO CENSUS OFFICE
page.content: A group of children from our class went to visit the Census Office in Corstorphine. We had to wear special visitors' badges and we were told how all the information is gathered for the Government and that it is very confidential. Every household in the land must complete a form on Census night (every ten years) and the country is divided up into districts. People called enumerators go round all the buildings to give out and later collect all the forms and finally all the information on the forms is turned into statistics. No names or addresses are associated with the information when it is published and the Census forms are kept secret for about 100 years. The information is important for planning schools, housing, public transport, and health and welfare programmes.
